Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BNAUK
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the morning of Friday for a long weekend break. We guessed that we may have to wait for the room, but the receptionist said it was ready. Our front facing top floor room was a little small with a tiny bathroom. Had TV, Kettle and a fridge, but no safe. The safe was located at reception. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. When asked if there was free WIFI, he provided the details straight away. Luckily there was a ilft as the stairs looked a little daunting! I would recommend this little hotel. It's clean and tidy and not far from the centre. Get a train to the Amsterdam central. Tram 1,2,5 to Leidseplein, and the hotel is a short walk from there. Amsterdam it's self is a great city. You need to hire a bike! We hired from Mac bikes which was priced at approximately 15 euro per day, but the longer you had it the cheaper it is. The Red Light area is shocking! And a little sad. Anne Frank house; queue or order online to beat the queue. Everything is expensive, and the best place to drink is in little pubs in Jordaan, where you meet the locals for a friendly chat.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget choice in a great location, 10 minutes from Leidseplein.”
Reviews.Author: petejonno
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends in a triple room in November 2011. The location is great, 5 to 10 minutes walk to the Leidesplein area which is great for a few drinks in the various pubs and bars. It is about a 20 to 30 minute walk to the centre and the red light district etc, but hotels I have stayed in which were closer to the center have always seemed to be a much lower standard than this, despite costing more. Nearby is a Lidl supermarket which was very handy and much cheaper for basic supplies than your averadge corner shop. There are gorgeous canals and parks close by and a general laid back feel to the area, away from most of the tourist traps. The hotel itself is a small, family run place and is quite basic, but very clean, and the owners were very polite and helpful and seemed happy to have you staying with them. The room was great and had everything we needed, and the bathroom was recently renovated and to a very high standard. I have visited Amsterdam on several occasions and will definately choose this hotel for future visits - perfect if your looking for a clean, resonably priced and friendly place to return to after a days sightseeing (or whatever else you may do in Amsterdam).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely,family run hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Lulabella_nat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights last weekend and I cannot fault this place! The family who run this are so charming, helpful and really care about their clientele, which I don't think you get very often with the big corporate run hotel chains... Although the room was a little on the small side, it was clean and tidy and the hard bed did wonders for our backs! I want one! The location is wonderful and only a few mins walk from the Leideseplein, from where you can jump on a bus straight to the airport for only 4euro! Get the 197 and you get a sightseeing tour thrown in! I guess the only niggle is the noise of the lift in the morning, as the rooms are all close together near the lift, but dont let that put you off! Would we stay again? DefInitely, and we're planning on returning very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Smart, clean, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa W
Reviews.Content: From the outside and reception area, we were a bit dubious, but the room was super clean and although small, quite comfortable. It was obviously newly decorated, and the bathroom was spotless. Quite a good location too, only a short walk from the Liedesplein, where there are lots of bars, shops, cafes etc, along with the Boom Chicago Comedy Club which was ace (all in English). It's also close to the Museumplein and there is a tram stop just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: lauren b
Reviews.Content: We arrived here for two days. Loved this small, friendly hotel we were doing it on a budget and this place proved to be just the job. Trams are the easiest way to get about the city and theres stops outside. The room was fine, clean cool and comfortable. The buffet in the morning was good the bacon is hard but strangely memorable and on the second morning I decided I had to have seconds. The Dutch are so helpful if you need to know where to go in the city anyone will do more than help. Cheap and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: chacow
Reviews.Content: Close to Leidseplein, wide range of choices for restaurants and night life. Quiet and safe 10 minutes walking to Leidseplein. Our room was comfortable and clean. We had good rest. We were there 4 days in October 2011, was the last 2nd stop of our honeymoon. We were happy to stay there and didn't ruin our vacation mood at all after 14 days Mediterranean cruise of Star Princess. It is family operated business, they care each customer very much. Dennis and other staffs were very helpful and friendly. Charles from San Francisco architect

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ClemBrussels
Reviews.Content: The key here is: reasonable price. Hotels are expensive in Amsterdam. I booked an appartment for 3 persons for 160â‚¬. The appartment, located on the opposite side of the street, was huge, the interior tasteful, only the beds a bit narrow. Excellent bathroom. Limited breakfast buffet but of very good quality. (Good coffee in Holland? Trust me...) Very friendly staff. Rather good location, close to museum quarter and Leidseplein but quite a distance from Central Station. Main disadvantage: no parking. So if you come here, either obey rule number one for traveling to Amsterdam by car (i.e.: DON'T) or don't fret about either paying 8â‚¬ an hour for parking, or driving half an hour to a car park and coming back by (slow) tram.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: cazparry3
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a reasonable price. The location was ideal, away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to walk into the centre. The service was friendly and helpful although we were asked to pay when we checked in, so we did therefore ask to see the room beforehand which was lovely. We had also kindly been upgraded to a larger room which had all the mod cons, nicely decorated, comfy bed with a very good clean bathroom. Would recommend this hotel for those who want to stay in a peaceful area near the lovely Museum and Jordaan area.

Reviews.Title: “Small but central!”
Reviews.Author: shawnjmartin
Reviews.Content: A small hotel with small rooms however, clean, refurbished and central! The service staff are brilliant and very helpful. The rooms have TV's and are adequate for a few days stay. Can become cramped though if your there for a week or more. Everything is walking distance from the hotel and taxi's are cheap for the first 10 -15 minutes of the ride. Usually that's all the time it takes to get somewhere via taxi. Walking is more enjoyable though as you see a lot more in the compact city. Free WI-Fi and the connection of it is good!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not 3 star!”
Reviews.Author: Ns1717
Reviews.Content: Good location for museums and ledisplein. Room ok. Would've preferred mugs to plastic cups and no coffee or milk supplied, just 2 tea bags and a couple of sugars. Shower ok. Toilet paper rough so purchased own. Fridge but no minibar. Steep stairs but there is a small lift. Bed ok but little hard. No nice views. Sheets not changed during stay. Nice flat screen tv. Good fast free wifi. Breakfast not included in our booking. We didn't partake - it was 7â‚¬ each for continental. Better deals on nearby ledisplein. Hotel was pretty quiet but Walls and floors pretty thin. So could hear others. Def a no frills hotel, bit like a old UK travelodge but with less rooms. Advice - pay a bit more and stay at a nice NH!

Reviews.Title: “Check room before paying”
Reviews.Author: pinktoes29
Reviews.Content: I contracted a very serious infection from bed bug bites from this hotel. I have emailed the hotel to advise them and received a standard response saying they took the matter seriously and would get back to me. This hasn't happened. I therefore have no idea whether this matter has been looked into. I would suggest that if you stay at this hotel, that you thoroughly check the bed and the room for bed bugs before paying for your room. I would not book the room through a website - I would physically check the hotel and room before any bookings are made.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly pleasant hotel in a great location and at a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: mama08aq
Reviews.Content: The other reviews of this hotel don't do it justice. The hotel is in a great location in Amsterdam - just two minutes walk away from the Leidsesplein and five minutes from the Vondelpark, so very central without being smack bang in the red light district or the tourist areas. The hotel is located in a quiet residential street, in an old , and we had a beautiful balcony where we could look out to a canal. The lobby of the hotel looks kind of shabby, but don't let that put you off - the rooms are nicely furnished and quiet. We had a great night's sleep! If you're looking for an inexpensive hotel in Amsterdam to stay, that is centrally located, then this is definitely it. The only drawback to some could be the vertiginous staircase, but there is an elevator anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kpinmaine
Reviews.Content: We had a great three night visit at the d'Amsterdam Hotel last week. I had a really hard time choosing an Amsterdam hotel that was affordable but still nice and am so pleased I made this choice. Location was great -- right near the Leidsplein and within an easy walk to the museums and other sites. Staff was very pleasant and helpful and went out of their way to make our visit enjoyable. Also, the balcony and refrigerator were total bonuses. Only gripes I have is that the soap or cleaner they use smelled a bit strong for my taste and the bed was a bit too firm for my liking. This isn't a super fancy place, but if you're wanting to stay in spendy Amsterdam without sacrificing quality, then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A cute hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Viktsjob01
Reviews.Content: This hotel was incredible. Just the way you would imagine a cute smaller Dutch hotel to be like. When checking in the owner greeted us in a very welcoming way. She helped us with our greatest concern; the parking. She really went the extra mile when it came to helping us. There was also a computer in the reception and you were allowed to use it for 15 minutes a day. We found that being quite helpful! The rooms were normal size and were very clean and fresh. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms had empty refrigerators where you could put food and drinks in. There was also AC and the bathroom was great. The breakfast was okay, but still enough to make you last till dinner time. The breakfast staff refilled the food when necessary and there was a good selection to choose from. The hotel was also very central and everything was walking distance. Amsterdam is a beautiful city and definitely a place I will come back to. When I do, I will most certainly stay at this hotel again! A thing to keep in mind is that this hotel is not staffed around the clock, however the door was always locked. We got a key to unlock it whenever we entered. This made us feel very safe and was not to any trouble at all.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a quiet area”
Reviews.Author: mintkiwi
Reviews.Content: i've stayed in a hotel d'amsterdam for a week and liked it. it's a small hotel in a quiet area. rooms are not very large, clean and bright. stuff are very very helpful, polite and careful. there is also free and fast wifi in the rooms. the only disadvantage of the hotel is it's location. the hotel is located far from the center and attractions (15-20 minutes walk). however there are several streets full of bars and restaurants nearby so there is no problem to find the place to go out in the evening. so i would say it's a good hotel especially for it's price but next time i'll prefer hotel located closer to the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good indeed”
Reviews.Author: weekender0001
Reviews.Content: PROS: This hotel has a lot of pros. Friendly staff, air con, en suite, near Leidseplein with lots of bars etc. Near the museum district. Free high speed wi-fi. Tram is very close and Bus 197 will bring you to the airport for a few euros. Quiet street. Comfortable bed. No hassle. CONS: Not many cons really. Quite far from the city centre (red light district etc). Rooms could do with a touch up with paint.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay at Hotel d'Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: bebech1981
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is a very expensive city and this hotel in comparison with what you can get elsewhere in this city is a very good value for money. The staff is really helpful and will do everything to answer your questions. The hotel and the room were very clean (room was cleaned every morning). Very close to city centre, you just need to cross the canal and you are on Leidseplein. Very close to the museum area (15/20 minutes walking). Car and bike rentals + Tram lines 1, 2 and 5 are few minutes away. Will go back to the same hotel if visiting Amsterdam a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Our Reviews are Based on Value of Monies Spent”
Reviews.Author: CMoney_Tbone
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is one of the top three most expensive cities in Europe. That being said, this little gem of a hotel exceeded expectations. This hotel is located outside of the grungy city center and yet near museumplein (Van Gogh, Rijks, Vondel Park, ect...). A couple other benefits of the location were the proximity to tram travel and also restaurants. The room and bathroom were very clean, the staff exceptionally sweet, and the included breakfast adequate (pay attention to where you are before you judge!). Is it someplace you would take your mother? YES, we did, and were not let down.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: C_Bridge85
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for one night only during our trip to Amsterdam due to difficulty booking our main hotel for the full duration of our stay. Overally I was pleased and thought it was great value as hotels in central amsterdam of a decent standard are expensive. I think you can't get better quality for the price in this city. I's not galmorous but its clean and well kept which are excellent starting points. A previous reviewer noted the beds were uncomfortable but mine was fine so it might be an individual room... The hotel is very near one of the main squares in the nicer end of town in the museum quarter. This side of town feels much safer and friendly in comparison to closer to the red light district. It was also handy to be so close to the bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some flaws”
Reviews.Author: writermonad
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and spoke perfect English. The room was very clean and modern. It contained (almost) everything we wanted, i.e., flat screen TV, fridge, and hair dryer. The bed, however, was below standard and appeared to be run down, as you are essentially forced to lie in the middle to not risk falling off one side. The hotel offers free wireless internet access, but the connection was very unstable (the wireless reception was good, but the actual internet connection of the hotel seemed to be overwhelmed at times). The hotel is located within walking distance to the city center (10min) and many shops are close by. The street of the hotel is nevertheless very quiet. All in all, I think it's hard to find a better value for your money in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: S_Christel
Reviews.Content: Our first impression upon arrival was that the hotel was quite simple and needed some colour to welcome you, however you soon realize that the welcome, helpfulness and friendliness of the staff makes everything quite bright. From restaurant suggestions, (the Indonesian was great), to making reservations, arranging taxi for early morning departure, lovely breakfast with fresh baked croissants. All made our stay a pure pleasure. Beds were made up everyday and everything was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice plce to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Rickey23
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on line and were very pleased when we checked in. The rooms were small but very clean. The couple who ran the hotel went out of their way to help us and show us places to go and things do. The breakfast was very well done. It is a bit of a walk to get down to where be were going but there are several attractions very near. It is only a couple of blocks to the tram stop for the 1, 2 and 5 trams to get to the Central Station. If we went to Amsterdam again we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay. Lovely room and service. Definitely come back.”
Reviews.Author: pliu88
Reviews.Content: I read the mixed reviews but decided to still stay at this hotel. The hotel is well positioned and the staff are wonderful. The breakfast was well stocked and adequate with a good selection. The hotel was clean and my room was very comforttable. We slept really well. The bathroom was really clean. I couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a good nights sleep but not too far from town”
Reviews.Author: FunkyMarshmallow
Reviews.Content: Hotel D'Amsterdam is in the perfect location, a short walk to Leidseplein with all the bars and restaurants but in a quiet location just far enough away from the noise of the city. Room was perfect for our needs, clean comfy bed, fresh clean towels every day. Breakfast was continental with excellent choice, the perfect set up for a day in the city. It even has an elevator so ideal for anyone not wanting to climb thoses steep stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of trying to cancel they will rip you off.”
Reviews.Author: CaptainCanary_10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the Expedia link and was aware of the 7 day cancellation policy. However we were held up on a previous trip due to the Volcanic Ash. As this meant we had extra unplanned time off work we had no choice but to cancel the booking. So, 6 days 12 hours ahead of time we contacted Expedia and explained the situation. They were very sympathetic and said that under the circumstances they were sure the Hotel would not charge us. However the Hotel refused. I then contacted them several times myself and they insisted upon charging me. I know it was not their fault but I would have thought that given the situation they might have relaxed their policy. Especially as they were probably benefiting from having extra bookings from others stranded there. I checked on the day of my booking and found that surprise surprise they were fully booked and so had obviously relet my room. I contacted them again to no avail.

Reviews.Title: “A Major Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: PrairieRover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel d' Amsterdam in 2007 and enjoyed it. My room was tiny and very basic, but it offered good value for money & the location is perfect, just down the street from the Rijksmuseum. When a family event in the Netherlands was planned for this year I decided to return. The room I had this time around was bigger, although a little on the shabby side. Within minutes of checking in I was treated to construction noise overhead which went on to 5:30pm with no sign of stopping. As I had hoped to get some rest in the afternoon I asked the receptionist what was happening & when it would stop. This is when the fun began. Turns out they were remodelling the room immediately overhead and the workers weren't leaving any time soon, and they were planning on starting again at 7am the next day. The receptionist didn't seem to understand that I wanted a quiet room & was completely unhelpful. After a lengthy and increasingly frustrating conversation he very grudgingly agreed to change my room - but only for 2 of the 3 nights I had booked. He had no solution for the 3rd night & didn't seem to care if I wound up sleeping on the street. While I was trying to figure out my options, I also discovered that the workers were smoking while they worked. While I'm not allergic, I'd rather not have to deal with second hand smoke; besides, the hotel is supposed to be smoke-free. The receptionist didn't care about this either. On the whole this had to be one of the worst customer service experiences I've had in a while. The only good thing is that I managed to get my money back and was able to bunk in with relatives at the Mariott nearby (which was excellent). I don't know if the hotel is under new management or if the staff I dealt with were new at the hospitality trade, but this hotel isn't the slightly quirky, comfortable and inexpensive place I stayed at in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but Clean, Adequate, and in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: CNT_09
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Europe, so coming from the States, the room size was a culture shock. However, there was nothing really wrong with it. A small clean bed, a table, a lamp, and enough room to dress. I wasn't traveling to Europe to sit in a hotel room, so it was a good fit. The bathroom is on the 2nd floor with a very steep narrow stairway. If you have trouble with stairs, this is not the place for you. The bathroom was also pretty small, but got the job done. I didn't travel to Europe to sit in the bathroom either. The location was great. Very near Rembrandtplein with several resturants and bars nearby. An easy walk and even easier bike ride to the Museum District, Dam Square, the Red Light District, and anywhere else you want to be. The owner was very friendly, the place was clean and felt safe, and prices were very reasonable, especially on weekdays. A couple of things to be aware of: You have to pay in cash (euros) upon arrival. If you book online you only pay the deposit with a credit card, so be prepared. Also, there is no Breakfast involved, so it is more of a Bed and No Breakfast. I didn't care and wasn't expecting breakfast, but if you are expecting to be served a meal in the morning, you will be disappointed. I spent, I think 4 nights total in this place, so I must have liked it. It is small, but if all you are looking for is a place to store your things, sleep, and take a quick shower, this offers you the privacy of your own room for a reasonable price in a great location. If you are looking to get out of a hostle, but don't want to pay for a full scale hotel, I think this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room - Ever!”
Reviews.Author: AuroraSky
Reviews.Content: The tiniest room - still it had a bathroom. Frankly there was nothing attractive about the room but it did provide a place to sleep. The location was certainly convenient to get to the sights. And it offered free internet. The breakfast was good. Still, I would not rush to return.

Reviews.Title: “no problems with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DublinBrianer
Reviews.Content: am somewhat astonished at previous review, found this to be acharming hotel, reasonable rate for amsterdam, decent buffet breakfast, lovely couple running hotel, always somebody available for reception, 32 channel tv in room, airconditioning, elevator in hotel, would definitely recommend, also free internet (15 minutes per visit) at front desk

Reviews.Title: “The worst B&B, avoid it at all cost”
Reviews.Author: lulu_mango
Reviews.Content: Bed & Breakfast without breakfast? Yes. Stayed two nights at the end of June with my parents. Booked this nice looking b&b on expedia.com. Nothing is like the pictures of this b&b. There is no sign of bed & breakfast at the street address. The receptionist is a waiter in the little dinner at Utrechtestraat 18, he called someone to pick us up to another house 5 minutes from there. The stairways are scary and the room has nothing but mattress, No A/C, No phone, No night table. The washroom is even worse. No argument that the location is good, but I will never stay there again or recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in an expensive town”
Reviews.Author: kateycAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Hotel D Amsterdam met our needs well. We were pleased that the room had a refridgerator and a kettle, which was a nice touch, not to mention some TV in English. The room was of average size and was very clean. The owners were nice and the breakfast was quite nice. Overall it was a comfortable stay, and whilst it was quite expensive, that is in line with the cost of other accommodation in Amsterdam (particularly at the weekend). Location was good too, not too far from the action, but far enough away to be safe and quiet and close to the Vondelpark which is absolutely delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dan_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in September and 3 nights in October, which was both at the start and at the end of a little Europe adventure. This hotel is a family-run business, therefore the staff were great! The room we stayed in the first two nights was on the first floor, directly over the front entrance. The room was small (to be expected of course!) and clean. It had everything we needed! The only downfall with this specific room (room 1) is the noise coming from the street/main entrance below. the window was old and didn't seal properly, so we could hear the smoker's conversations coming from outside at the front entrance, which really wasn't that much of an issue... The breakfast is good and simple: bread (toast), cheese, cold cuts, cereal, pastries, etc. Our second time around we were in room 3, which faces the back of the building. This room was very quiet, and the room (and washroom)was a little bigger than the first one we had stayed in. Again, this room was also very clean. I would definately stay at this lovely little hotel again! We stayed here a total of 5 nights and I have no real complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe and good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Chefward
Reviews.Content: The Hotel d'Amsterdam was exactly what I needed. In a city full of otherwise either very expensive or potentially quite seedy hotels, the room was exceptionally clean, seemed to be in a safe neighborhood and was a decent overall value. The room itself was quite small, but adequate for my needs. Bed was a twin with very nice, crisp linens. The bathroom was also quite small - comically so. It was, however, in the room, clean and private. Free internet in the lobby with a 15 minute limit on it, but available 24 hours. Breakfast was included in the rate. It did provide for coffee, cereal, pastries and some fruit and while it was not exceptional, it was free (or included anyway), and convenient. The woman working the desk was very friendly and helpful - I believe that she was the owner. She was able to give me information about the city and answer my questions quite well - also speaks multiple languages. She did request that I pay in cash, but I got the impression that if this had been an issue that she would have accepted a credit card. Overall, especially when compared to rates of other hotels in Amsterdam - this seemed to be a good deal and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No more than ok”
Reviews.Author: unidentified_hero
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights - bad sound isolation, owners don't get out of their skin to help you. They like your money though. Owners don't reply by e-mail. Breakfast is pretty bad choice, the next morning we got bread from previous day. Good thing there is a computer in the lobby - 15 min surf is free

Reviews.Title: “Good value but they don't take credit cards”
Reviews.Author: bobbers
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, a couple blocks off the tram line but it makes it a quiet night. Room size seemed bigger than typical European budget hotel, and it had a mini-fridge. Door seemed thin in that you could hear your neighbors coming and going, but no other noise problems. An earlier review mentioned that staff did not accept credit cards. This is true - there are not credit card stickers in the window Other than that little hurdle, I'd stay there again. I thought the rate I was pretty good, about one hundred each night for a double.

Reviews.Title: “Unique city”
Reviews.Author: ellington7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 3 night break and found the owners friendly and helpful since we had been delayed and it was midnight when we arrived.Our room was clean and serviced every day and was not cramped.This centrally situated hotel is in a quiet area and ideally placed for walking around the better parts of this wonderful city

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: AmyTravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located. You can walk to it from the Eurorail, walk to the Anne Frank haus, and everywhere else. The breakfast is lame and the staff made us pay cash (even though we booked our hotel on our mastercard, they said they didn't take credit cards when we got there and that we would have to pay cash if we wanted to stay there). Weird, but still a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: pih1959
Reviews.Content: phil, rich & ash. hull uk, motorcycle holiday in holland and germany. we stayed one night on route to cochem in germany, we thought the hotel was very good we paid 151 euros for the b & b for the 3 of us, very good value, the room was clean, spacious and basic, the breakfast was good and would recommend it, it's close to all the attractions, ther is a good irish bar the first square you come to, if you want 5 star pick a hotel in dam square for 300 euros a night!! all the best, the 3 amigo's.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location!”
Reviews.Author: Flossloss
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an amazing location! It's just far enough outside the very centre of Amsterdam to be quiet, but to still be within walking distnace of the major attractions and sights. It is small and they use the space really well. We arrived well before check in time and the staff welcomed us, stored our suitcases and offered maps and advice about the city. Our room was very comfortable and although the bathroom was tiny, the water pressure was fantastic and the room was kept very clean and fresh. The bed was great and we slept well every night. The satellite TV was a bonus and it was great to have a fridge in the room. Breakfast was an excellent selection for a continental buffet and set you up really well for the rest of the day. The staff happily booked taxis to the airport for us and explained anything we were unsure of - they spoke excellent English. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Crash”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dâ€™Amsterdam for four fantastic nights and I must say I am surprised to see the negative reviews left by other travellers, as my experience of the hotel is very positive. Dâ€™Amsterdam is in a great location, with all the major art galleries within walking distance, other attractions are also close and easy to reach by tram, although we chose to walk most places. I found the room to be of adequate size, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was a delicious buffet style set up served in a pleasant dining room, the food was fresh with ample servings of everything. The landlady was on hand during breakfast but I felt she was there to ensure that you had all you needed and to replenish supplies, rather that to â€œwatch over youâ€� as other reviews have mentioned. We found the owners to be very helpful, especially when the Connexions airport bus failed to turn up to take us to the airport. The owner tried to arrange alternative transportation for us but when this was not possible, he drove us to Schiphol himself, which I thought was very kind and went far beyond all expectations. We had a fantastic time in Amsterdam, made even more enjoyable by our stay at Dâ€™Amsterdam I would defiantly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olena-TRIP
Reviews.Content: I am surpised by the negative reviews of other traveller, because we enjoyed our stay at the hotel very much. Our triple room was for two of us and it was spacious enough with a balcony and a beautiful view on one of the canals. There was no fraud about that - we booked a triple room and we did have it. The breakfast was very good and I'd say abundant, the care being taken to have all the dishes full all the time. The location is great, you really can reach the museum within a short walk distance. There is a parking for bikes too. You are given an electronic key to enter the hotel, thus there's no problem to enter the building at any time without asking to open the door. It has a lift , which is very important, because those buildings in Amsterdam have terrible stairs to climb. I would return there again and recommend it to my freinds.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: joviscot
Reviews.Content: Room was small, mattress was not very good to sleep on, but it was more hubbys side that had the problems than mine!!! Window wouldnt close - on closer inspection, we noticed that the window was broken!! Our room was in the front, it was a wee bit noisy but not too bad. We wouldnt be staying here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this one!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the location but that was about all this place had going for it. We stayed in two different rooms over 3 nights. The first room was definitely not big enough for two adults with luggage. The last night we had a larger room but we also paid more for it. Overall the rooms and bathrooms weren't particulary clean. The remote was broken, lightbulbs were out and the towels were ready to hit the rag pile. The breakfast wasn't worth it all and the owner tends to hang out in the dining area. You get the feeling she's making sure you don't eat too much. Not a problem because it wasn't very good anyway. We go to Europe at least once a year and this is the worst hotel we've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: geordie_couple
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel only to be greeted by news that we did not exist! The hotel was run by a husband/wife team and although the husband did all he could to help, the wife on the other hand could not have been more indifferent. She blamed the booking agency throughout, but made no attempt to contact them, suggesting that she herself was responsible for the complete and utter ----up, whilst attempting to blame us for it by alluding to the fact that our credit card may have been the problem!!!!!!!! So after sitting around the lobby for two hours we were shifted to another hotel across the canal (no attempt by the way to call a taxi for the journey, oh no, we had to walk). On returning the following morning, we further sat around the lobby because our room was not yet ready. Having read the other reviews, it would appear that we were given the same room too. To say it was small is the art of the understatement. When it was time to leave, we asked if we could stay in the lobby to wait for the shuttle and were met with a shrug and that indifferent stare. All I say is if that woman went to any sort of training to run a hotel she ought to ask for a refund.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: hi i spent three nights at this hotel. the first night the owner gave us an okay sized room. the next two nights she said she was booked and gave us an extremly small room.there was room for two people to just sleep. we had to get things out of our luggage and zip them up again and put them aside to be able to get out of bed in the morning. the shower was just a shower head in the bathroom with a drain on the floor so when you shower you are over the toilet and get everything wet. she served breakfast in the morning and watched you like a hawk at the breakfast room while you were eating. it was very uncomfortable. if you are looking for a room to just crash in and have very little luggage then it's ok but if you want to be comfortable you better make sure they give you a big room.i personally would never go back.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a nice htoel. It was easy to get to from the central train station and it is close to a lot of nice things, the rates are good and with the included breakfast it is a good value. the only down side is that the room was small and we ended up fighting with our luggage for space but the room was very clean and funtioned well. I would stay at again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel d'Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Tweede Helmersstraat 4, Amsterdam 1054 CH, The Netherlands
